image:image.image:caption: Planning a visit to the Smokey Bear Ranger District near Ruidoso? Check out our update on the closure order specifics, including listed trails.

image:image.image:title: Village Officials Photo Gallery - Councilor Rafael "Rifle" Salas
image:image.image:caption: Born in Ruidoso in 1963, Rifle grew up in neighboring Alamogordo, NM. After graduating high school he served in the U.S. Navy, and then returned to Ruidoso in 1983 to work as a laborer for Ruidoso Parks and Recreation Department. He became director of the Ruidoso Parks and Recreation Department in 1997 and served 11 years in that position. He was appointed to the NM Public Employee Retirement Association (PERA) board in February 2002 serving ten months. He was then elected to serve on the Ruidoso School Board from 2005 to 2010. Rifle was elected to the Village Council in March of 2010. Having worked his entire career for the village of Ruidoso (VOR), he is dedicated to the residents and visitors of Ruidoso. He serves as Associate Pastor at Grace Harvest Church, and he has three children and three grandchildren. Organizations: • Member of the Ruidoso Senior Citizens Golden Age Club • Village of Ruidoso representative for the Green Tree Solid Waste Authority Board My Personal Mission Statement: The second major reason for my existence is to serve others. Education: High School Diploma Hobbies: Hiking and Kite-flying Councilor Salas' Goals Maximize good quality water production, utilize strategic planning for future water use including conservation, reuse and regionalization, and continue our efforts to secure Water Rights. Evaluate services for the purpose of reducing fee rates. Invest money and resources for Village employees. Make available sufficient resources todepartments of the VOR in order to provide quality services to Ruidoso residents Mayor Pro Tem Term of Office: March 2014 – March 2018 Contact information: PO Box 1122 Ruidoso, NM 88355 T: 575-808-0430 E: RifleSalas@ruidoso-nm.gov

image:image.image:title: Village Officials Photo Gallery - Councilor Rafael "Rifle" Salas

image:image.image:title: Village Officials Photo Gallery - Councilor Lynn D. Crawford
image:image.image:caption: Over the years, Crawford has honed his skills as an entrepreneur who has owned a video business as well as a mechanical business that specialized in electrical service, plumbing and construction. He also spent time working as a catastrophe adjuster for a major insurance companies before he and his wife, Traci, decided to move to the mountain village of Ruidoso and open The Dream Catcher Café and Catering Company where it has operated continuously since 2006. He also serves as the General Manager of the Ruidoso Jockey Club, which is owned and operated by 400 independent members. Crawford believes that it is vital to Ruidoso that elected officials strive to solidify workable partnerships that can get things done and affect change. If elected, he is committed to work diligently on effective management of our water resources, our water delivery system and proper utilization of the wastewater facility. Crawford is active in a variety of civic organizations including: • Ruidoso Lodger’s Tax Committee • Military 365 Committee – Chairman • Ruidoso Hospice • Eco Servants • Ruidoso Bicycle Club • Active contributor to numerous charitable events He has two daughters: Amanda attends Abilene Christian University and will soon start law school; Cadyn attends Baylor Medical School. Councilor Crawford's Goals Solidify workable partnerships that can get things done and affect change. Work diligently on effective management of our water resources, our water delivery system and proper utilization of the wastewater facility. Foster a business-friendly environment that will attract, nurture and retain new businesses and families to the area. Term of Office: March 2012 - March 2016 Contact information: 2629 Sudderth Drive Ruidoso, NM 88345 Residence: 575-802-2222 Cellular: 432-352-2665 E-mail: RuidosoLynn@gmail.com

image:image.image:title: Village Officials Photo Gallery - Councilor Joseph W. Eby
image:image.image:caption: I was born in Seoul, Korea, and was brought to America (the Beautiful!), at the age of three with the first babies allowed out of that country after the war. Raised in El Paso, our family would come to Ruidoso to the family cabin every chance we would get. I moved to Ruidoso after graduating from high school, and lived here for three years before moving to Alaska, where I lived and built a business for 15 years. I always knew that I would come back to Ruidoso. I returned to Ruidoso in 1990, and have spent the past 22 years building a successful ceramic tile and marble installation company. My wife Ann and I have been happily married for 19 years. Ruidoso has always been home for me and has been the perfect place to live and do business. I wish to give back to the community to help guide in a responsible direction so that others would also see Ruidoso as the ideal community to raise families and build their businesses. Councilor Eby's Goals To help secure the resources that Ruidoso needs, mainly water, that ensure the health and viability of the Village. To have a budget that provides the necessary services and utilizes the people’s money efficiently and wisely. Common sense decisions that benefit the Village, the residents, businesses, and visitors of our area. Term of Office: March 2012 - March 2016 Contact information: 407 College Drive P.O Box 692 Ruidoso, NM 88355 Residence/Fax: 575-258-9931 Cellular: 575-808-0114 E-mail: JoeEby@ruidoso-nm.gov

image:image.image:title: Village Officials Photo Gallery - Councilor Tim Coughlin
image:image.image:caption: Tim met his future wife Lori in high school, was married at 20 years old and they have been together for 33 years. Having been self-employed most of his adult life, Tim learned how to manage employees, control spending and run a successful business. Tim served as a board member of Guajome Park Academy, a 1400 student charter school and as President of the Guajome Park Academy Foundation. Since moving to Ruidoso in 2009, Tim and Lori have been involved with volunteering and supporting our community. He served as Vice President of the Lincoln County Humane Society, President of the Community Youth Center Warehouse and as a surveillance officer with the 12th District Courts Juvenile Drug Court Program. Tim served as an Alternate Judge for the Village of Ruidoso and a member of the Village of Ruidoso Parks & Recreation Commission. Tim currently serves as the Chairman of the New Mexico Chapter of The Professional Association for the Boys & Girls Clubs of America and as the Executive Director of the Boys & Girls Club of Sierra Blanca. Councilor Coughlin's Goals Protect our water sources and improve our infrastructure to minimize water loss Develop a plan to maintain and repair our buildings and other assets Assure that we continually consider the ramifications of our decisions on future generations Term of Office: March 2014 – March 2018 Contact information: 134 Reese Drive Ruidoso, NM 88345 575-808-8338 Office 575-973-5469 Cell Email: TimothyCoughlin@ruidoso-nm.gov
